column1: In the six years since the first film
column2: Wreck-It Ralph and Vanellope von Schweetz have stayed best friends
column3: hanging out after work in Litwak's Arcade. One day
column4: Vanellope expresses how bored she has become of Sugar Rush's tracks
column5: so Ralph sneaks into the game and makes a new track for her. The arcade player fights Vanellope's control
column6: causing the cabinet's steering wheel to pop off. Mr. Litwak attempts to reattach the wheel to the console
column7: but accidentally breaks it in half. As the company that made Sugar Rush is defunct
column8: and the cost of a replacement wheel on eBay is too high
column9: Litwak decides to scrap Sugar Rush
column10: and unplugs the game. With Fix-It Felix and Tamora Jean Calhoun's help
column11: Ralph finds homes for all its citizens as a short term measure as they figure out how to save the game. After talking with Felix
column12: Ralph decides to grab Vanellope and travel to the Internet via Litwak's new Wi-Fi router. With the help of the search engine KnowsMore
column13: they are directed to eBay. They end up winning the auction for the wheel
column14: but they unintentionally spike the price to US$27
column16: and only have 24 hours to come up with the funds or they will forfeit the bid and lose the wheel. On the way out
column17: they run into clickbait salesman J.P. Spamley
column18: who offers them a lucrative job of stealing a car from Shank
column19: the lead character in the popular online game Slaughter Race. They steal Shank's car
column20: but she stops them before they can leave the game with it. Shank explains that there are better ways to make money on the Internet than stealing
column21: and she then makes a viral video of Ralph and uploads it to video sharing site BuzzzTube
column22: and tells them to check with BuzzzTube's head algorithm
column24: about getting money for it. At BuzzzTube
column25: Yesss is elated by how popular Ralph's video is
column26: and they come up with the idea of making more videos
column28: will earn them the money for the wheel in no time. Vanellope offers to help advertise the videos
column29: and Ralph has Yesss send her to """Oh" My "Disney""." There
column31: being encouraged by them to address her sense of un-fulfillment and reaching a musical epiphany. Once Ralph makes enough money to purchase the wheel
column32: he contacts Vanellope through a device Yesss had given them; he finds Vanellope talking with Shank about staying in Slaughter Race
column33: having found her epiphany there due to its relative novelty compared to Sugar Rush. Ralph asks Spamley for a way to draw Vanellope out of the game
column34: and he takes him to the deep web vendor Double Dan. Dan provides Ralph with a virus
column36: that feeds off insecurities and replicates them. When Ralph unleashes Arthur into Slaughter Race
column38: triggering a server reboot. Shank and the others help Vanellope to escape before the game resets. Ralph confesses to her that the crash was his fault
column39: and an outraged Vanellope ends her friendship with Ralph and throws away his hero cookie medal
column40: causing it to break in half. Arthur copies Ralph's insecurities and starts making duplicates of Ralph. The clones soon overrun the internet in a DOS attack
column41: all chasing after Vanellope to keep her for themselves. Ralph saves her and attempts to lure the clones into a firewall
column42: but they form a giant Ralph monster that seizes them both. Ralph comes to accept that Vanellope can make her own choices
column44: and causing the giant Ralph monster and the clones to disappear. Ralph gives half of the broken medal to Vanellope and they bid each other a tearful farewell as Shank has arranged for Vanellope to respawn in Slaughter Race. Back in the arcade
column46: and Ralph partakes in social activities with the other arcade characters as he stays in touch with Vanellope over video chat
column47: feeling content with his ability to be independent.
